page.title: 03FARMING IN EAST COKER
page.content: The importance of farming is shown by the{16 farms}found in the block.The average size of each unit is thus fairly small,but farming practises are {efficient and intensive}and yields are high.Most farms are run as{family {units}and have been in the family over many generations. Most farmers concentrate on{mixed {farming.}A high proportion of the land is intensively managed grassland;much of the cropland is used to grow fodder crops. { Land prices}are above the national average.Grade 1 cereal land fetches Â£2000_Â£2500 per acre(avge.Â£1700) whilst dairy land fetches Â£1600_Â£2000 per acre. Westfield and Redland farms,run as a Partnership and covering 356 acres illustrate{farming practises}in the area.
